hardware.name: Red Legs, A Bipedal Robotic Walking Platform
hardware.tag: Senior thesis for Electrical & Computer Engineering major. I revamped the electrical system, reverse engineered existing controllers, and designed new PCB and programmed STM32 microcontroller.

hardware.name: DinoPill, automating Chrome's T-Rex game
hardware.tag: For when you don't have an internet connection, just pop a DinoPill on to your screen and watch that little dinosaur jump.

hardware.name: Yet Another Ray Tracer
hardware.tag: Learning how to build a ray tracer, with a twist. The twist is it's running on an STM32 development board. I used this project to hone my Test Driven Development skills, and my C++-fu.

hardware.name: Yet Another Ray Caster
hardware.tag: Learning another graphics rendering technique, also on the STM32F4 board, hoping to incorporate the on-board gyro sensor

hardware.name: view-board/ nopixel
hardware.tag: An interactive data-visualization tool, inspired by Google's AnyPixel.js project. view-board is comprised of 49 back-lit arcade buttons, all of which can be controlled by an npm module, and communicated via a virtual Serial Port.

hardware.name: Lightning Globe
hardware.tag: An art installation, the Lightning Globe brings lightning from all over the world into your room, using data collected by the World Wide Lightning Location Network. A JSON file with lightning locations is parsed, and mapped to a pixel, creating a mesmerizing light show.

hardware.name: Mareep Charlieplex
hardware.tag: An attempt at a charlieplexed LED keychain, in the shape of your favorite sheep Pokemon. The backside houses an ATTiny85 microcontroller and coin cell battery.

hardware.name: Sous Vide Rice Cooker
hardware.tag: An ex-rice cooker found a new lease in life in a temp-controlled hot water bath. Makes a perfectly rare lamb shank, which can rarely ever be perfect.

hardware.name: room-light
hardware.tag: The owner of this project nearly suffered an almost fatal heart attack upon finding out how much it costs to RGB-fy his entire apartment. Dauntless, he set out to build his own version using a strip of RGB LED and his own sweat and tears.

hardware.name: twitch-plays-drums
hardware.tag: An elegant musical instrument for a civilized age, Twitch Plays Drums scans Twitch chat for uses of common emotes and assigns them a value, which is then played on a mechanized drum set (read: drum sticks hot glued to servos and pointed at various household items. For maximum chaos, use this on a LoL stream

hardware.name: Simultaneous Localization and Mapping on TurtleBot
hardware.tag: For RBE3002 at WPI - A SLAM algorithm for the TurtleBot, running on Robotics Operating Systems and Python.

hardware.name: VGA Animation on FPGA
hardware.tag: For ECE3829 at WPI. Programmed and displayed simple animations through VGA interface. Built test fixture to verify logic in Verilog.

hardware.name: Guitar Hero clone on MSP430
hardware.tag: For ECE2049 at WPI. Programmed a rudimentary, 16-bit clone of Guitar Hero. Surprisingly fun with Mario's Underwater theme playing.

hardware.name: Colossal Ascent
hardware.tag: A Hackathon project. Custom wireless game controller interfacing with an Unity game, which supports multiple controllers and sends data via UDP packets. We did not win, which was a huge unjust.

software.name: Landing Page
software.tag: A riddle, wrapped up in an enigma.

software.name: Yet Another CHIP-8 Emulator
software.tag: My take on the ubiquitous CHIP-8 Emulator, as an exercise in C, CMake. Plus I have always wanted to learn how an emulator works. Future roadmaps include adding sound functionality, and porting the emulator to an embedded platform (e.g. ESP32).

software.name: Seven Hills Assistive Technology Database
software.tag: As part of my Interactive Qualifying Project, our team was tasked to build a searchable database of assistive technologies available at Seven Hills Foundation, a nonprofit that provides support for adults and children with disabilities.

software.name: Reversi (Othello) AI
software.tag: Final project for Artificial Intelligence course - a genetic algorithm agent that learns how to play Othello.

software.name: SteamHour Chrome Extension
software.tag: A foray into the world of Chrome Extensions. I wrote this after finding myself playing too much games. The extension lives on your hot bar, and displays how many hours you spent playing games in the past two weeks. Sadly it was quickly abandoned in favor of playing more games.

software.name: Gregify Chrome Extension
software.tag: A blight upon the world, Gregify will turn any pronouns on your browser into Greg. Inspired by a Reddit thread. As of this time, there are 14 users. God bless their souls.

software.name: libopencm3_cmake
software.tag: Boilerplate CMake files for libopencm3, an open source low-level hardware library for ARM microcontrollers.

misc.name: Carved Elephant
misc.tag: Carved wooden elephant for someone who's favorite animal is elephant. She loves it.

misc.name: Modern Coffee Table
misc.tag: Who needs IKEA furniture when you can spend a whole day working on a shoddy but ultimately cool looking coffee table for your fancy frappucino?

misc.name: End Grain Cutting Board
misc.tag: My first attempt at a hip cutting board. It ended up being too small and broke after a couple of uses. Fun looking though

misc.name: End Grain Cutting Board, revisited
misc.tag: My second attempt fared a bit better - though a lack of sufficent sealing did not make for a happy ending.

misc.name: Lucky Money Envelope
misc.tag: Lunar New Year Lucky Money envelope I made to give out to friends and family. An exercise in stampmaking.

misc.name: Nostos
misc.tag: Picture of my childhood home, being repainted before being sold.

misc.name: Planet Express
misc.tag: Layered laser cut plywood for one of my favorite shows. Playing around with wood materials.

misc.name: Self-portrait
misc.tag: Crude drawing of my crude God given face.

misc.name: Hufflepuff
misc.tag: Someone's favorite house being Hufflepuff. She loves it.
